subject: Re: [junit] How does Unit test in a heirarchy works...
msgSnippet: My classes in the heirarchy uses different set of behaviour.  Apart from this I would want tests to be run at different levels. If I can move common code, I
messageBody:
My classes in the heirarchy uses different set of behaviour. Apart
from this I would want tests to be run at different levels.

If I can move common code, I would move to a helper. (with this
instance accessible to all).

~JAK

On Apr 6, 2005 9:24 PM, Anurag Setia <anuragsetia2000@...> wrote:
>
> The requirement might need the methods in the parent class to be used in
> child class in which case you cannot remove the relationship between the
> two.
> For example, if there is one class MAMMLE and one class DOG, you cant
> inherit both from ANIMAL coz there would be methods in MAMMEL that DOG
> requires.
>
> Rick
>
>
> Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> Arun J wrote:
> > Folks,
> >
> > I have a heirarchy of test cases.(jUnit/cactus based). Some
> > test cases are run at the parent level and some are run at
> > the child level. My observation is this. When I run my child
> > test cases it traverses to the parent and runs the parent's
> > tests also. My question is this..
> >
> > #1. Can I stop my derived Unit tests from running parent
> > tests.?
>
> If you don't want to rerun the tests from the parent class, I assume that
> you are reusing some other code from it?
>
> What if you simply moved that code to a common (abstract) base class and
> don't any longer let the child class inherit from the parent class (but let
> both inherit from the abstract base class)?
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>
>
>
